info.name: Merchant API
info.description:
# Introduction

As a Revolut Business customer, you can use the Merchant API to accept online payments (Card Not Present) by debit or credit cards, and also to manage the orders and customers.

This Postman collection lets you try Revolut's Merchant API.

To see the full documentation of the Merchant API, visit: [Revolut Docs - Merchant API](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/merchant-api).

## Authorization

Each Merchant API request must contain an authorization header in the following format to make a call:

``` json
"Authorization: Bearer <yourSecretApiKey>"

 ```

Use the predefined environment variables (`secret_api_key`) in Postman to authorize your API calls. Make sure to use your Sandbox and Production Secret API keys with the corresponding environments!

Select the environment you want to use in the top-right corner.

To learn more about authorization, see: [Merchant API - Authorization](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/merchant-api#authorization).

### API versions

We highly recommend using versioning in your API calls. If you don't provide a version header on the operations where it's required, you will receive an error response.

The Merchant API uses request header versioning. Where it is required you need to use the `Revolut-Api-Version` header parameter to specify an API version. Each request, where it is indicated in the API specification, must contain a version header in the following format:

```
 'Revolut-Api-Version: 2023-09-01'

 ```

For more information, see: [API versions](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/api-versions)

item.name: Orders

header.description:
The version of the Merchant API, specified in YYYY-MM-DD format. If not specified, you will receive an error. 

For more information about API versioning, see: [API versions](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/api-versions)

request.description:
Create an `Order` object.

Full documentation: [Merchant API - Create an order](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/create-order)

query.description: The maximum number of orders returned per page. Used for **pagination**.

Retrieve orders with a `created_date` < `created_before`. Used for **pagination**. Use the `created_date` of the last order returned in the previous response to get to the next page.

The default value is the current date and time you are calling the endpoint.

Retrieve all orders with a `created_date` ≥ `from_created_date`. Used for **filtering**.

Use the [ISO date format](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) : `yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ss[.SSSSSS]Z`. For example, `2021-02-10T16:59:50.886826Z`.

Retrieve all orders with a `created_date` ≤ `to_created_date`. Used for **filtering**.

Use the [ISO date format](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) : `yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ss[.SSSSSS]Z`. For example, `2021-02-10T16:59:50.886826Z`.

Retrieve all orders that have this `email` associated to them. Used for **filtering**. 

This parameter is case sensitive.

Merchant order ID for external reference. Use this field to filter and retrieve all the orders that have this ID. Used for **filtering**. 

This parameter is case sensitive.

Retrieve all orders with specific states. You can pass several states. Used for filtering.

If multiple states are selected, for example `AUTHORISED` and `COMPLETED`, orders with either of the selected values are returned. 

The parameter is case sensitive.

request.description:
Retrieve all the orders that you’ve created. You can also use the query parameters for:

- Filtering
- Pagination
    

The response contains an array of simplified `Order` objects.

Full documentation: [Merchant API - Retrieve an order list](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/retrieve-order-list)

header.description:
The version of the Merchant API, specified in YYYY-MM-DD format. If not specified, you will receive an error. 

For more information about API versioning, see: [API versions](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/api-versions)

request.description:
Retrieve the details of an order that has been created. Provide the unique order ID, and the corresponding order information is returned.

Full documentation: [Merchant API - Retrieve an order](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/retrieve-order)

header.description:
The version of the Merchant API, specified in YYYY-MM-DD format. If not specified, you will receive an error. 

For more information about API versioning, see: [API versions](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/api-versions)

request.description:
Update the details of an order.

Specific limitations apply based on the state of the order, see full documentation: [Merchant API - Update an order](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/update-order).

Capture the funds of an existing, uncaptured order. When the payment for an order is authorized, the order is captured and sent to the processing stage.

Full documentation: [Merchant API - Capture an order](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/capture-order)

Cancel an existing uncaptured order.

Specific limitations apply based on the state of the order, see full documentation: [Merchant API - Cancel an order](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/cancel-order)

Issue a refund for a completed order. A refund can be either full or partial.

You can initiate a refund for an order only when it is in the `COMPLETED` state.

Full documentation: [Merchant API - Refund an order](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/refund-order)

Initiate a payment to pay full amount for an order using a customer's saved payment method.

Full documentation: [Merchant API - Pay for an order](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/pay-order)

item.description:
To process the order from a credit or debit card, you create an `Order` object. You can then retrieve, capture, cancel, refund, or pay an order using its unique `id`. Alternatively, you can use its unique `public_id` to process a card payment with the Revolut Checkout Widget.

See full documentation: [Merchant API - Orders](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/orders)

item.name: Customers

request.description:
Create a customer that has the information in the body of the request.

Full documentation: [Merchant API - Create a customer](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/create-customer)

Get a list of all your customers.

Full documentation: [Merchant API - Retrieve a customer list](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/retrieve-all-customers)

Get the information about a specific customer, based on its ID.

Full documentation: [Merchant API - Retrieve a customer](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/retrieve-customer)

Update the attributes of a specific customer.

Full documentation: [Merchant API - Update a customer](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/update-customer)

Delete the profile of a specific customer.

Full documentation: [Merchant API - Delete a customer](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/delete-customer)

item.name: Retrieve all payment methods of a customer

query.description: Boolean. If `only_merchant` is set to `true`, you retrieve the payment methods that were saved for the merchant (saved_for: "MERCHANT").

request.description:
Retrieve all the payment methods for a specific customer.

Full documentation: [Merchant API - Retrieve all payment methods of a customer](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/retrieve-all-payment-methods)

variable.description: The ID of the payment method.

request.description:
Retrieve the information of a specific payment method that is saved.

Full documentation: [Merchant API - Retrieve a customer's payment method](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/retrieve-payment-method)

variable.description: The ID of the payment method.

request.description:
When you use this request to update a customer's payment method, the payment method can't be used by the merchant to initiate transactions any more. This payment method can be used only when the customer is on the checkout page.

Full documentation: [Merchant API - Update a customer's payment method](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/update-payment-method)

variable.description: The ID of the payment method.

request.description:
Delete a specific payment method.

Full documentation: [Merchant API - Delete a customer's payment method](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/delete-payment-method)

item.description:
`Customer` objects enable you to track multiple transactions associated with the same customer.

Full documentation: [Merchant API - Customers](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/customers)

item.name: Payments

request.description:
Initiate a payment to pay full amount for an order using a customer's saved payment method.

Full documentation: [Merchant API - Pay for an order](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/pay-order)

variable.description: The ID of the Payment object.

request.description:
Retrieve information about a specific payment, based on the payment's ID.

Full documentation: [Merchant API - Retrieve payment details](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/retrieve-payment-details)

item.description:
Payment operations enable you to initiate payments, or track payment status transitions. You can use the ID of the payment to retrieve information about a specific payment.

Full documentation: [Merchant API: Payments](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/payments)

item.name: Payouts

query.description: The maximum number of payouts returned per page. Used for pagination.
Retrieve all payouts with a `created_date` ≥ `from_created_date`. Used for filtering.
Retrieve all payouts with a `created_date` ≤ `to_created_date`. Used for filtering.
ISO 4217 currency code in upper case.
Retrieve all payouts with specific states. You can pass several states. Used for filtering.

request.description:
Retrieve all the payouts you made from your Merchant account. You can also use the query parameters for:

- Filtering
    
- Pagination
    

Full documentation: [Merchant API - Retrieve a payout list](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/retrieve-payout-list)

Retrieve the details of a payout. Provide the unique payout ID, and the corresponding payout information is returned.

Full documentation: [Merchant API - Retrieve a payout](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/retrieve-payout)

item.description:
Payout operations enable you to list payouts, or track payout status transitions. You can use the ID of the payout to retrieve information about a specific payout.  
  
Full documentation: [Merchant API: Payouts](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/payouts)

item.name: Disputes

query.description: The maximum number of disputes returned per request.
Retrieve all diputes with a `created_at` value ≥ `from_created_date`.
Retrieve all diputes with a `created_at` value ≤ `to_created_date`.
Retrieve all disputes with specific states. You can pass multiple values.
Retrieve disputes related to one or more payments based on their IDs.

request.description:
Retrieve all the disputes linked to your Merchant account. You can also use the query parameters for:

- Filtering
    
- Pagination
    

Full documentation: [Merchant API - Retrieve a dispute list](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/retrieve-dispute-list)

Retrieve the details of a dispute. Provide the unique dispute ID, and the corresponding dispute information is returned.

Full documentation: [Merchant API - Retrieve a dispute](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/retrieve-dispute)

Marks a specific dispute as accepted. After accepting a dispute, you cannot challenge it.

Full documentation: [Merchant API - Accept a dispute](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/accept-dispute)

Allows uploading a single evidence file for a specific dispute. Use these evidences to provide proof for claims when challenging a dispute.

Full documentation: [Merchant API - Upload evidence for a dispute](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/upload-dispute-evidence)

Allows challenging a dispute with a reason, comment and associated evidences. Use the uploaded evidences to provide proof for the challenge.

A dispute previously accepted, cannot be challenged.

Full documentation: [Merchant API - Challenge a dispute](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/challenge-dispute)

item.description:
Dispute operations enable you to list disputes, or track dispute status transitions. You can use the ID of the dispute to retrieve information about a specific dispute.  
  
Full documentation: [Merchant API: Disputes](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/disputes)

item.name: Report runs

request.description:
Start generating a new report of the relevant transactions.

Full documentation: [Merchant API - Create a new report run](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/create-report-run)

variable.description: The ID of the report run.

request.description:
Retrieve details of a report run, based on the `report_run_id`.

Full documentation: [Merchant API - Retrieve report run details](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/retrieve-report-run-details)

variable.description: The ID of the report run.

request.description:
Use this endpoint to download the generated report file.

Full documentation: [Merchant API - Download report file](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/download-report-file)

item.description:
In addition to the CSV statements you can export via the [Revolut Business Dashboard](https://business.revolut.com/merchant/statement), you can generate custom CSV reports using the **Report runs** operations. Unlike the default statements, creating custom reports offers you more flexibility in determining what data you wish to incorporate. This allows you to have more control over your analytics.

Full documentation: [Merchant API: Report runs](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/report-runs)

item.name: Webhooks

request.description:
Set up a webhook URL so that the Merchant API can push event notifications to the specified URL.

Full documentation: [Merchant API - Create a webhook](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/set-webhook)

Get a list of webhooks that you are currently subscribed to.

Full documentation: [Merchant API - Retrieve a webhook list](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/retrieve-all-webhooks)

Get the details of a specific webhook.

Full documentation: [Merchant API - Retrieve a webhook](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/retrieve-webhook)

Update the details of a specific webhook.

Full documentation: [Merchant API - Update a webhook](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/update-webhook)

Delete a webhook so that events are not sent to the specified URL any more.

Full documentation: [Merchant API - Delete a webhook](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/delete-webhook)

Rotate the `signing_secret` for a specific webhook.

Full documentation: [Merchant API: Rotate a webhook signing secret](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/rotate-webhook-signing-secret)

item.description:
A `webhook` (also called a web callback) allows your system to receive an event from a different app immediately after it happens.

Full documentation: [Merchant API - Webhooks](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/webhooks)

item.name: Locations

request.description:
Create a `Location` object.

Full codumentation: [Merchant API: Create a location](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/create-location)

Retrieve a list of locations registered for the merchant.

Full documentation: [Merchant API: Retrieve location list](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/retrieve-location-list)

Retrieve details of a specific location, based on its ID.

Full documentation: [Merchant API: Retrieve a location](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/retrieve-location)

Update details of a specific location, based on its ID.

> **NOTE:** The value of the location's `type` cannot be updated. 
  

Full documentation: [Merchant API: Update a location](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/update-location)

Delete a specific location, based on its ID.

Full documentation: [Merchant API: Delete a location](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/delete-location)

item.description:
The Locations API is designed to allow merchants to manage multiple online storefronts. Registering locations lets you differentiate and group your orders from different stores. You can also introduce custom processes for your orders on each location.

Full documentation: [Merchant API: Locations](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/locations)

item.name: Other

request.description:
Register your website's domain to accept payments via Apple Pay.

Full documentation: [Merchant API - Register domain for Apple Pay](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/register-domain-apple-pay)

item.name: Register address validation endpoint for Fast checkout

request.description:
Use this endpoint to register a URL where Revolut can send shipping address(es) from a Revolut Pay customer for validation during the [Fast checkout process](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/guides/accept-payments/payment-methods/accept-payments-via-revolut-pay2/fast-checkout).

Full documentation: [Merchant API - Register address validation endpoint for Fast checkout](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/register-address-validation-endpoint)

Retrieve a list of synchronous webhook objects.

You can use this endpoint to see your different address validation endpoints registered to different locations.

Full documentation: [Merchant API - Retrieve synchronous webhook list](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/retrieve-synchronous-webhook-list)

Delete a specific synchronous webhook registration, based on its ID.

Full documentation: [Merchant API - Delete a synchronous webhook](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/delete-synchronous-webhook)

item.description:
Other operations that can be done with the Merchant API.

Full documentation: [Merchant API - Other](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/other)

item.name: Deprecated

request.description:
Create an `Order` object.

Full documentation: [Merchant API - Create an order (Deprecated)](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/legacy/create-order-deprecated)

Retrieve the details of an order that has been created. Provide the unique order ID, and the corresponding order information is returned.

Full documentation: [Merchant API - Retrieve an order (Deprecated)](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/legacy/retrieve-order-deprecated)

Update the details of an order.

Specific limitations apply based on the state of the order, see full documentation: [Merchant API - Update an order (Deprecated)](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/legacy/update-order-deprecated)

Capture the funds of an existing, uncaptured order. When the payment for an order is authorized, the order is captured and sent to the processing stage.

Full documentation: [Merchant API - Capture an order (Deprecated)](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/legacy/capture-order-deprecated)

Cancel an existing uncaptured order.

Specific limitations apply based on the state of the order, see full documentation: [Merchant API - Cancel an order](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/legacy/cancel-order-deprecated)

item.description:
Deprecated operations.

If you are using any of the operations listed here, we recommend to upgrade to the new versions.
